@gunan And also, for this issue. I think it's because in Bazel build we use /MT option to statically link into C runtime, but in CMake, we use /MD to dynamically link into C runtime.
That's causing Python code and C++ not sharing the same C runtime in Bazel build, so the environment variable is not propagated from Python to C++.
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/2kzt1wy3.aspx
